website_summaries.verdict: An excellent entry in the Micro Four Thirds universe, the Olympus PEN E-P5 should please a lot of folks, but it's also expensive given that it doesn't deliver best-in-class photo quality.
pros: The Olympus PEN E-P5 renders extremely good photos for its class, and has a streamlined shooting design
cons: The navigation button/dial is annoyingly awkward, and I wish the flash tilted

customer_reviews.title: Superb camera
customer_reviews.text: Pros Takes fantastic pictures Very well made Compact and much easier to carry than a full size DLSR OR FF mirrorless Functions can be extensively customized Works well at low temperatures (0-10 below Fahrenheit) Good battery life Image stabilization is fantastic. Cons Built in flash is anemic. Heavy for its size Control menu system needs to be re-thought.
customer_reviews.author: Quiet Gardener

customer_reviews.title: Very nice camera with super effective IS
customer_reviews.text: Very nice camera with super effective IS. Unfortunately, the software crashed couple of times, and then the IS stopped working altogether. I had to reset it every time that happened! Also, The camera in this combo feel surprisingly heavy and is not comfortable to hold over a long period of time. The lack of a proper handgrip causes the discomfort, so a shoulder or neck strap are a must. Otherwise great little camera with fast and fairly reliable autofocus! The bundled lens is very sharp and easy to focus manually. The EVF is large, bright and sharp but sits very clumsy on top of the nice camera body
customer_reviews.author: Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Small, light with big performance.
customer_reviews.text: This is a keeper. It's quiet, has all the features you could ever need and takes beautiful pictures. I use it with the 12-40mm pro lens and this combination has awesome image quality with beautiful saturation and colors with subtle gradations. The learning curve requires a little patience, but it's worth it. It's even better with the VF-4 electronic viewfinder which is clear and bright even in low light. I love this camera!
customer_reviews.author: Phillip R. Marcus

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: The performance of this camera is incredible. In virtually all respects it has exceeded expectations. The combination of small size, big power and lots of features make it a great choice. No regrets whatsoever. I did not give the camera 5 stars because the Olympus menus could be simplified. The Super control panel is not a default item, but should be. Without it, navigating the menus is ridiculous.
customer_reviews.author: HenleyTEX

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny...
customer_reviews.text: This is a smart and hip little camera that really delivers on all the hype. As someone new to photography I didn't really know what to expect quality wise and was staggered by the results. The heavy metallic (as opposed to light & plastic) build can only be described as "sexy." Biggest problem is that all my relatives are asking for copies of the photos I took over the holidays. Ordered the 12mm f2.0 wide and 45mm f1.8 portrait lenses a few days after.
customer_reviews.author: cajunroo

customer_reviews.title: Enjoyable camera
customer_reviews.text: Vivid colors and sharp pictures when paired with good lenses. Better yet, this is a small, unobtrusive, camera with a very quiet shutter once the "beeps" are turned off.
customer_reviews.author: LeRoy Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Nice Results, Nice Style
customer_reviews.text: I'm not going to argue the differences between a D-SLR and a Micro Four Thirds system. This camera gives nice results and has a lot of lens available in all price ranges. The camera has a nice look and feel. It is light, but you can get functional lenses that are not that heavy or overbearing. Sometimes manual adjustments are a little buggy getting them to lock in. It may be my inexperience, but in the digital age, it should not take experience to press a button and have it kick in in the change between 1000 and 3200, for example.
customer_reviews.author: Anne Brody

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic camera
customer_reviews.text: Fabulous camera. Inside and out. Fast, touchscreen is cool, and the photos look great so far. You won't be disappointed...haven't even explored all the setting yet...
customer_reviews.author: Ms. N. Griffin

customer_reviews.title: both modes
customer_reviews.text: I own several PENS including the EP3, and EPL5. This is a significant step up models. Image quality and Handling are top notch despite the fact that the grip is not interchangeable.
customer_reviews.author: 1inventorTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Wow.  Best value I've seen in forever.
customer_reviews.text: I took this camera out of the box and could not believe it was refurbished. A beautiful jewel. Excellent camera - one of Oly's best. I use this for almost everything...
customer_reviews.author: Scott Stafford

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: An excellent micro four thirds camera used ex+ from KEH.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Deaver

customer_reviews.title: Olympus is the best~
customer_reviews.text: Very beautiful camera. Olympus is the best manufacture in the camera industries. The picture's that taken from this camera is so awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Duane

customer_reviews.title: Arthritis meant ending my long love affair with Nikon and Nikkor and downsizing
customer_reviews.text: Arthritis meant ending my long love affair with Nikon and Nikkor and downsizing. After agonizing about which way to go i settled on the EP5, the VF4 and the Olympus 40-150 zoom and 25mm f1.8 lens. I'm in love again and highly recommend all of the above.
customer_reviews.author: James P. Burns

customer_reviews.title: Excellent camera!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome camera! Great size. Great pictures. Extremely fast! This is my go to camera. No need for heavy digital cameras for pro shots.
customer_reviews.author: D. Epstein

customer_reviews.title: If its what you need
customer_reviews.text: Still learning what all it will do. Tough to make intuitive
customer_reviews.author: Frances Hedberg

customer_reviews.title: Clicking Noise Issue
customer_reviews.text: The ep5 body and vf4 is great. The 17mm 1.8 is disapponting. It produce a clicking noise that will be heard all over the video. If you are to buy this bundle, be sure to check the video capability first of the lens. I regret not doing that. Hence i have to bring it to olympus for repair. And olympus does not even repair it for you. They will send you back and fort and waste your time. I will be sending mine back on monday its my 2nd time around sending it back.
customer_reviews.author: von

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: Ok, this is hard to review since mine died after 1 1/2 days. While it worked, I really started to enjoy it, it is quick, the evf is really nice even while wearing glasses. The wifi worked great, the playback is the best I've used. But...if the camera won't hold up to heavy use and carry, then it is no good to me. Mine might be a fluke, but I will not get another one and have it die on me a month from now. I hope everyone else's experience with this model will be good.
customer_reviews.author: FredMech

customer_reviews.title: The best street camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera is small, black, viewfinder and screen can tilt, 17mm*2 lens is ideal for street! Nothing more to add. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Mikhail Davydov

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera with dial skip problem
customer_reviews.text: I like everything about the camera with the exception of the dials failure. I’m out of warranty and the repair by Olympus for others with dial problem has been hit or miss with repeat failures. If you can deal with the dial problem it’s a great camera.
customer_reviews.author: Carol38

customer_reviews.title: A powerful little camera!
customer_reviews.text: I love how fast it is (fast AF, fast FPS) and how well the 5-axis IS works! It's also a huge improvement in ISO range compared to my E-P2!
customer_reviews.author: Raoul Pop

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Camera
customer_reviews.text: I could not decide between the PEN EP-5 or the OMD EM-5. In the end I decided I did not need weather sealing and built in viewfinder. So I went with the newest model. I am very happy with this camera. The VF-4 viewfinder is superb. Wi-Fi works very well and pictures are great. The menu and getting used to camera functions do take some getting used to. Overall very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: awesome camera, pretty good ergonomics
customer_reviews.text: light, easy to carry, solid picture quality and very customizable. . I moved my camera system from Nikon full frame to M43 and i'm happy i did. It does everything i want it to do and I have it with me way more often than my much bulkier FF. FF Nikon still takes better photos, but this one does almost as well in a much smaller package when coupled with the awesome M43 primes.
customer_reviews.author: arkoid

customer_reviews.title: Weak Video Capabilities
customer_reviews.text: Solid build quality but Olympus is now lagging seriously behind in video support. The single frame rate and paltry bit-rate in such a high-dollar camera with such capable hardware come down to nothing but neglect. A better video codec would in no way sacrifice stills image quality or camera size, as cameras smaller and 1/3rd the price handily demonstrate.
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: A flawed design
customer_reviews.text: I cancelled my pre-order after I had a chance to handle an ep5. It's a substantial camera and needs a larger grip to be held securely. I'll buy one as soon as an add-on grip is available.
customer_reviews.author: Uncle Frank

product_meta.title: Olympus E-P5 16.1MP Mirrorless Digital Camera with 3-Inch LCD- Body Only (Black)
product_meta.description: Color:Black| Style:Body OnlyDesigned with a modern twist to the original PEN F, fans of the award-winning Olympus PEN family of cameras now have the Olympus E-P5 PEN Mirrorless Digital Camera Body. The flagship PEN body that delivers a portable, premium quality experience. The E-P5 is packed with the latest innovations Olympus technology has to offer including 1/8000s Shutter Speed, 5-Axis Image Stabilization, "F.A.S.T" AF Speed, Built-In Wi-Fi capability, 2x2 dial control and more.Advanced Design for a New GenerationThe Olympus PEN E-P5 carries on the essence of the design found in all Olympus PEN cameras and advances its appearance to a new level. Exacting attention is made to materials, form, texture and color. The body is finished to be seamless, none of the screws can be seen on the sides, front or top of the body. Form and operability of dials, levers and buttons are positioned for optimal ease-of-use and comfort.1/8000s Mechanical ShutterThe E-P5 is the worlds first mirrorless camera equipped with a 1/8000 sec. high-speed mechanical shutter which allows you to freeze action without blur. Use prime lenses at their maximum aperture allowing you to capture beautifully defocused background images even in very bright daylight.Precise Flash Sync up to 1/320sSyncing your flash with fast shutter speeds is typically tricky; the flash is just too fast! The E-P5s shutter can sync with the built-in flash at shutter speeds up to 1/320s. This maximum sync speed gives you greater flexibility choosing the correct exposure settings when shooting outdoors in bright of back-lit conditions where fill flash on your subject is desirable.9 FPS Sequential ShootingHigh-speed sequential shooting as fast as 9 fps can be accomplished when using the Tracking AF (C-AF+Tr), which works in tandem with the Autofocus to follow your subject.
feature_bullets: Twin control dials (front and rear) with '2x2' dual-mode option
1/8000 sec top shutter speed, 1/320 sec flash sync
'5-axis' image stabilization with automatic panning detection ('S-IS Auto')
Up to 9 fps shooting (5.0 fps with continuous AF)
Intervalometer and Time Lapse movie creation
1.04m dot 3" LCD touchscreen display - tilts 80° upwards and 50° downwards
Built-in Wi-Fi for remote shooting (iAuto only) and image transfer to smartphone or tablet
Optional VF-4 electronic viewfinder: 2.36M dot LCD, 0.74x magnification (equiv), eye sensor

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.7 out of 5 stars55 ratings3.7 out of 5 stars
